item.title: One Command File Server
item.description: You need to host a web server to access the file in your file system. However, you don’t need to install a complex software to do it. There is a built-in simple web server in python3 which makes your work done. $ python -m http.server Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8000 (http://0.0.0.0:8000/) ...

item.title: Tips for working with bash
item.description: While you are doing awesome stuff, some noisy things bother you. The following tips might help you out.

item.title: Build a micro ORM in Golang
item.description:
The problem of ORM library

Writing a data access layer is tedious for developers who are not familiar with SQL and the Paradox of Choice with ORM libraries. Many developers usually use a most-stared ORM library on Github and might end up with unexpected behaviors because some features in the library do over-engineering their requirements.

item.title: Update all docker images
item.description: Docker does not have a command to update your images to latest version that you have already pulled in your system by default. Sometimes, we want to update image to latest version because of bugs or vulnerabilities. This action is similar to apt update && apt upgrade in debian-based system.

item.title: Install packages offline on RHEL-based distribution
item.description: Some of my customers have policies to install packages in offline environment. This article summarized useful commands for working with RHEL server.

item.title: Hi ‚úåÔ∏è
item.description: I‚Äôm Kha Nguyen (Kha Nguy·ªÖn). I am an AI engineer based in Seoul, South Korea. I work applying machine learning to problems in software engineering. I have applied machine learning techniques to a wide range of practical problems in web security and financial system. I am always willing to take on challenging problems and continually learn new things in both artificial intelligence and security domain. I occasionally share my thoughts on programming, CTF write-up, and life journey on this corner.
